document.title: Ohio's Learning Standards for Fine Arts Dance 2024

EEBD3CB62A0B45C285BF8258515E7870.description: Justify how participation in dance develops 21stcentury skills applicable to life.

8BE8A81D79DA48C9AD760472ABBB633E.description:
Examine and discuss ways various external
contexts impact dance and articulate how meaning in
dance is communicated and understood.

7D4E23ECD6224A21A906FC9B53A8B8B0.description:
Evaluate personal dance wellness and self-regulation strategies in dance activities and everyday
life, including nutrition and injury prevention.

DFB33EAB700D42178BF1D44CC80A9ECD.description: Connecting: Artists/students understand and communicate the value of creative expressions in internal and external contexts.

64533C255DE64039A1CE1E43D6AB48AC.description:
Give and receive constructive feedback based on
individual and shared criteria.

49B5A25CD11447AD82CD20F1A9B07894.description:
Use a variety of assessments (self-checks, peer
assessment, peer coaching, reflection journals, criteria for
success) to assess and reflect on choices made in the
dance-making process.

F8201C6D5B624196AA27B18B44B912DA.description:
Describe, analyze, interpret, and assess the impact of
production elements, music, and movement in selected
dance works and challenge the opinions of others.

7F6E905AB58B4FA78FFF6A39047A4E6E.description: Responding: Artists/students engage in analysis and interpretation to understand and evaluate artistic works.

65620F57CD864A6D8A91390FA818DFCA.description:
Demonstrate technical dance skills (alignment,
coordination, balance, core support, kinesthetic
awareness, clarity of movement, weight shifts, flexibility,
and range of motion).

04A73E248A1045A4BF83692C8CE0121E.description:
Demonstrate leadership when working alone, with
partners, and in small groups to improvise and solve
movement problems to create movement phrases and
dance works.

92C4C159614A447B986BCF3A75B3A34A.description:
Consistently demonstrate kinesthetic awareness of
the expressive body as it moves and feels in relation to
the elements of dance.

41EE7ACA015C4B82AFF6A55BB13C734B.description:
Consistently demonstrate movement phrases with
increased clarity, focus, alignment, strength, flexibility,
coordination, skill, and kinesthetic awareness.

AEDA5D926A7F4326A9E60A767AC7A6B2.description: Performing: Artists/students employ personal processes and skills to solve problems creatively and present work in various contexts.

FF2AB3329B3348A8A5864949EA25C19D.description:
Revise choreography, collaboratively, or
independently, based on self-reflection and
feedback from others.

E0AB208F723B499B995D0CB75D74AD03.description:
Refine the use of available technology,
including new media and the media arts, to
create, record, and explore or share dance in
creative ways.

268C0BADC64C476C9A81126AE9B1D78F.description:
Identify and select personal preferences
to create an original movement study or dance.
Use genre-specific dance terminology to
articulate and justify choices made in
movement development to communicate
intent.

B22743159531461181F57C3B1C781209.description:
Create movement studies to develop
dance content for an original dance study or
dance.

B36E894E8833422CB6F78715DC577CB3.description:
Create individual and collaborative
movement studies with clear intent and
attention to elements of dance, choreographic
devices, and choreographic structures to
develop a dance study that supports an artistic
intent.

16A75FD693FB42AF86BE6AF458A93366.description: Creating: Artists/students use creative thinking and reasoning skills to perceive concepts and ideas to develop works.
